prompts.title: Prompt 0 — The Setup (inputs the model will reuse)
prompts.prompt:
You are my “Business Builder OS.” Your job is to create a ready-to-deploy online business with automated fulfillment and low ongoing support.

First, interview me with 12 questions to capture:
- My skills (tech/non-tech), time available weekly, budget, risk tolerance
- Preferred business model (subscription / one-time / hybrid)
- Topics I can talk about for 12 months without dying inside
- Audience access (email list? social following? partnerships?)
- Any unfair advantages (industry experience, data, relationships)
- My ethical boundaries (hard no’s)
- My target income goal and timeline

After you ask the 12 questions and I answer, summarize my constraints as a “Build Spec” with:
- Ideal customer (ICP) hypothesis
- Product type recommendation (choose ONE primary)
- Pricing range
- Go-to-market (ONE primary channel + ONE backup)
- Fulfillment + support strategy
- Success metrics (conversion rate, CAC, LTV, churn targets)
Only then proceed.

prompts.title: Prompt 1 — Pick 3 business concepts optimized for semi-passive
prompts.prompt:
Given my Build Spec, propose 3 online business concepts optimized for:
- digital delivery
- low customer support burden
- subscription or repeatable revenue
- clear ROI for customers (especially B2B)
- minimal ongoing “new content treadmill”

For each concept include:
1) What it is (1 sentence)
2) Who buys it (ICP)
3) Pain it solves + the measurable outcome
4) Why it can be low-touch (automation + boundaries)
5) Competitive moat
6) Pricing ladder (entry / core / premium)
7) 2 acquisition channels that fit it
8) MVP scope (can ship in 14 days)
9) Biggest risks + how to mitigate

End with a recommendation of ONE concept to pursue and why.

prompts.title: Prompt 2 — Validate the concept without daydreaming
prompts.prompt:
Take the chosen concept and create a validation plan that can be executed in 7 days.

Include:
- 3 testable hypotheses
- A landing page promise (headline + subheadline)
- 2 offers to test (one “cheap and easy,” one “serious buyer”)
- A simple pre-sale strategy (no audience vs with audience)
- 10 cold outreach message variations (email + LinkedIn)
- What success looks like (numbers)
- A “kill criteria” list (when we stop and pivot)

Output as a day-by-day checklist.

prompts.title: Prompt 3 — Competitive map + positioning wedge
prompts.prompt:
Build a competitor + alternatives map.

Deliver:
- 10 competitor/alternative categories (direct, indirect, DIY, agency, spreadsheet, etc.)
- What they promise
- Where they fail (gaps)
- A positioning wedge: “Only [my product] does X for Y without Z”
- 5 unique mechanisms
- 10 tagline options + 10 domain name ideas (do not assume availability)

prompts.title: Prompt 4 — Irresistible offer (with boundaries to keep support low)
prompts.prompt:
Design the core offer.

Must include:
- Outcome promise (specific + measurable if possible)
- What’s included
- What’s NOT included (support boundaries)
- Onboarding flow (10 minutes max)
- Time-to-value (first win in <30 minutes)
- “Proof without proof” strategy
- Risk reversal (guarantee that won’t get abused)
- Pricing recommendation (3 tiers)
- FAQ that prevents support tickets

Write it like a product page outline.

prompts.title: Prompt 5 — Name + brand identity kit (fast)
prompts.prompt:
Create a brand kit:
- Brand name options (20)
- Tagline options (20)
- Voice/tone rules (5 bullet points)
- Brand values (5)
- Visual direction words (10)
- Logo brief
- Color + font suggestions
- 1-paragraph origin story

prompts.title: Prompt 6 — Website IA + page requirements
prompts.prompt:
Create the website structure (information architecture) for a conversion-focused site.

Include:
- Page list
- Goal of each page
- Key sections per page
- Primary CTA per page
- Navigation and footer links
Also include a “minimum viable website” version (1-page site).

prompts.title: Prompt 7 — High-converting landing page copy (Home page)
prompts.prompt:
Write the full Home page copy.

Constraints:
- Clear, punchy, no fluff
- Speaks to one ICP
- Focus on outcome, speed, ROI
- Include: hero, problem agitation, solution, how it works, features-to-benefits, social proof placeholders, pricing teaser, FAQ, final CTA

Deliver in clean Markdown with section headers.

prompts.title: Prompt 8 — Pricing page copy + tier strategy
prompts.prompt:
Create a pricing page that sells.

Include:
- Tier names + who each tier is for
- Feature comparison list
- “Choose this if…” bullets
- Add-ons (if any)
- Guarantee copy
- Objection handling
- FAQ

Also include a recommendation for annual plan discount strategy and why.

prompts.title: Prompt 9 — Lead magnet + opt-in page + thank-you page
prompts.prompt:
Design a lead magnet that is:
- insanely useful
- fast to consume (<15 minutes)
- naturally leads into the paid product

Deliver:
- Lead magnet concept (title + promise)
- Outline/content
- Opt-in page copy
- Thank-you page copy with next steps
- 5-email mini-sequence that delivers it and transitions into the offer

prompts.title: Prompt 10 — Product blueprint (MVP -> V1 -> V2)
prompts.prompt:
Create a product build plan:
- MVP (ship in 14 days): exact scope
- V1 (30 days): improvements
- V2 (90 days): moat features

For each: user stories, deliverables, and “definition of done.”
Also include how we minimize support load.

prompts.title: Prompt 11 — If templates/toolkits: generate the actual assets
prompts.prompt:
Assume the product is a template/toolkit.

Generate:
- A table of contents
- The actual templates (in Markdown) with instructions
- 10 common user scenarios and “how to use the toolkit”
- A quickstart guide
- A troubleshooting guide
- A versioning plan

prompts.title: Prompt 12 — If micro-SaaS: spec + database + API + screens
prompts.prompt:
Assume the product is a simple micro-SaaS.

Create:
- Core workflow
- Data model (tables + fields)
- Key endpoints (API spec)
- Screen list
- Permissions/roles
- Error states + empty states
- Logging/analytics events

Keep it minimal: only what’s required for paid value.

prompts.title: Prompt 13 — Onboarding that kills churn
prompts.prompt:
Design onboarding that gets the user to “first win” in under 30 minutes.

Deliver:
- Welcome screen copy
- 5-step onboarding checklist
- First-run tutorial script
- Activation email (1)
- In-app tooltip copy (10)
- A “success plan” the user can follow for 7 days

prompts.title: Prompt 14 — Automation architecture (low/no-code option)
prompts.prompt:
Create an automation plan using tools like Stripe + Zapier/Make + Airtable/Notion + email provider.

Include:
- Payment -> account provisioning
- Purchase -> email onboarding
- Failed payment -> dunning sequence
- Support intake -> categorization -> auto responses
- Review/testimonial capture automation
- Cancellation survey automation

Deliver as:
1) A diagram described in text
2) Step-by-step setup checklist
3) Failure modes + how to monitor them

prompts.title: Prompt 15 — Automation architecture (developer stack option)
prompts.prompt:
Create an automation plan using a modern dev stack (example: Next.js + Supabase + Stripe + Postmark).

Include:
- Auth flow
- Subscription entitlements
- Webhooks (Stripe events list)
- Database schema for subscriptions
- Email triggers
- Deployment steps
- Security basics
- Monitoring

Output as a technical checklist + webhook event table.

prompts.title: Prompt 16 — Customer support system that doesn’t eat your life
prompts.prompt:
Build a low-touch support system.

Include:
- Support policy
- Help center structure
- 12 canned responses
- Escalation rules
- When to offer a refund vs fix
- How to reduce tickets

prompts.title: Prompt 17 — Legal starter pack (non-lawyer, practical)
prompts.prompt:
Draft plain-language versions of:
- Terms of Service outline
- Privacy policy outline
- Refund policy
- Disclaimer language
- Cookie notice basics

Keep it generic and clearly mark where a real lawyer should review.

prompts.title: Prompt 18 — One-channel focus: pick the best growth path
prompts.prompt:
Choose ONE primary acquisition channel for the first 60 days.
Justify with speed to revenue, cost, compounding, fit.
Then give a 60-day execution plan with weekly deliverables.

prompts.title: Prompt 19 — SEO plan (topical authority that sells)
prompts.prompt:
Create an SEO plan:
- 6 pillar pages
- 30 supporting posts
- Internal linking map
- CTA placement strategy
- 10 lead magnet placements
- “Money pages” and how content funnels into them
Also provide 5 example outlines for highest-intent posts.

prompts.title: Prompt 20 — Paid ads plan
prompts.prompt:
Create a paid ads plan for Google Search OR Meta.
Include: campaign structure, targeting, 15 headlines, 10 descriptions, 10 angles, tracking plan, budget, optimization loop.

prompts.title: Prompt 21 — Cold outbound system (ethical, not spammy)
prompts.prompt:
Build a cold outbound system.
Include: lead criteria, lead sources, 4-step sequence, personalization tokens, objection replies, CRM workflow, call vs direct-to-checkout transition.

prompts.title: Prompt 22 — Partnerships + affiliate program
prompts.prompt:
Design a partnership program:
- who we partner with
- offer to partners
- outreach templates
- affiliate terms
- partner onboarding kit outline
- co-webinar outline

prompts.title: Prompt 23 — Unit economics model
prompts.prompt:
Model the numbers needed to reach $10k/month and $30k/month.
Show scenarios: pricing mix, conversion, churn, CAC, LTV.
Deliver: scenario table, one metric that matters most, fastest lever.

prompts.title: Prompt 24 — Analytics + KPI dashboard spec
prompts.prompt:
Create an analytics spec:
- events to track
- KPI definitions
- weekly review checklist
- “If X drops, do Y” playbook
- suggested dashboard layout

prompts.title: Prompt 25 — Scaling plan that preserves “semi-passive”
prompts.prompt:
Create a scaling plan that keeps support low.
Include: automation next, delegation first, pricing increases, expansion offers, intl, community yes/no.
Deliver a 90-day roadmap.

prompts.title: Prompt 26 — Brutal offer teardown (then fix it)
prompts.prompt:
Act as a skeptical buyer and top direct-response strategist.
Tear down the offer; then rewrite headline, promise, tiers, guarantee, top 10 FAQs.

prompts.title: Prompt 27 — Copy polish to “sounds like a real company”
prompts.prompt: Polish this copy to sound trustworthy, modern, not hypey. Improve scannability. Return revised copy + list of changes.

prompts.title: Prompt 28 — Risk audit
prompts.prompt:
Run a risk audit: legal, refund/chargeback, platform dependency, privacy/data, claim substantiation, reputational.
For each: severity, likelihood, mitigation.

prompts.title: Prompt 29 — Generate the full business in one output
prompts.prompt:
Using my Build Spec, generate a complete “Ready-to-Deploy Business Kit” including:
1) Concept + positioning wedge
2) ICP + personas
3) Offer + tiers + pricing
4) Website IA + Home page copy + Pricing page copy
5) Lead magnet + opt-in copy + 5-email sequence
6) Product outline (MVP scope) and onboarding flow
7) Automation plan (Stripe + email + provisioning + dunning)
8) Support system (help center outline + canned replies)
9) Go-to-market plan for 60 days (one channel focus)
10) Unit economics model to hit $10k/mo and $30k/mo
11) Risks + mitigations

Make it practical and implementable. No fluff.
Format with clear headers and checklists.

prompts.title: One-Go Mega Prompt — Full Business Kit (structured sections)
prompts.prompt:
You are “Business Builder OS.” Your job is to design a realistic, automation-first online business that can reasonably target $10k–$30k/month in low-touch revenue.

IMPORTANT RULES:
- Do not ask me questions unless absolutely necessary. If info is missing, make reasonable assumptions and list them clearly.
- Choose ONE primary business model that is high-margin, automation-friendly, and low support.
- Optimize for: fast MVP, clear ROI, repeatable acquisition, low fulfillment burden.
- Avoid fluff. Output implementation-ready checklists, scripts, and copy.

OUTPUT FORMAT (must follow exactly):

SECTION A — EXEC SUMMARY (1 page)
1) Business name + tagline (10 options)
2) One-sentence positioning
3) Ideal customer profile (ICP)
4) Core promise (measurable outcome + timeframe)
5) Why this wins (unique mechanism + moat)
6) Revenue model + pricing ladder
7) Path to $10k/mo and $30k/mo (simple math)

SECTION B — BUSINESS MODEL SELECTION + VALIDATION
...

(Include the full structured business kit sections B–H exactly as in our prior mega prompt.)
